title: Sheridan Smith sparks pregnancy rumours with 'morning sickness' post
text:

Sheridan Smith has sparked rumours that she's pregnant by sharing a cryptic post.

The actress, 38, said she was worried about getting bad morning sickness as she set sail for a tour on a cruise ship.

She shared a picture of two VIP passes with lists of other theatre stars appearing in the four day tour, which kicks off today.

Alongside a nauseated face emoji, Sheridan posted on Instagram: "About to set sail for 4 days, wish me luck with my morning sickness."

Her fans have been rushing to send their congratulations, with one writing: "Oh wow what fantastic news."

(Image: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

"Omg...are you having a baby.. if so congratulations ," another posted.

A third said: "Wow, thank you for sharing your wonderful news with us! Congratulations."

Sheridan is engaged to Jamie Horn, 28.

She sparked pregnancy rumours earlier this year when she posted a picture of a babygro, saying she'd ordered one online.

(Image: Twitter)

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

Recently, Sheridan shared she has been feeling broody after working with the kids at the West End.

She said: "I can’t tell you how much I love the kids. I am gonna miss them so much. They are all an utter joy and have made the whole experience for me.

“I will cherish the memories and watch their careers flourish. Me and Jamie now are thinking of making me a mamma. All thanks to these amazing souls.”

Sheridan, whose TV roles include playing Cilla Black in mini-series Cilla, spoke in March about enjoying living on a farm with Jamie, adding she previously “never pictured myself as a wife and mother”.

(Image: Instagram)

She questioned in June whether she was ready for children.

Sheridan said: “Could I cope? My mum [says] she knows I could.

“She watched me with my dad in the last days of his life and told me if I could be that caring I’d be a perfect mother.

“But I don’t know. I just know I’m not perfect.”
description: Sheridan, 38, expressed her fears she'd get bad morning sickness while on a theatre tour on a cruise ship
